text: Madhava (or Madhava-kara) was a 7th-century or early 8th-century Indian physician who wrote the Rug-vinischaya, also known as the Madhava Nidana, which soon assumed a position of authority. In the 79 chapters of this book, he lists diseases along with their causes, symptoms, and complications. He also included a chapter on smallpox (masūrikā). == References == Category:Ayurvedacharyas Category:Ancient Indian physicians Category:7th- century Indian writers Category:8th-century Indian writers Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Year of death unknown Category:Indian male writers Category:7th-century Indian medical doctors Category:8th-century Indian medical doctors
title: Madhava-kara
